_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Tiarco Chemical Division
                                                                               Executive Summary

                                                                         REGULATED SUBSTANCE

Carbon Disulfide ( Cs2 ) - CAS# 75-15-0
Regulated as - Toxic Liquid
Maximum Amount onsite- 63,000 pounds
Location: Latitude 34.41.15     Longitude 84.59.37

                                                                           VESSEL OF CONCERN

10,000 GALLON Carbon Steel Storage Tank.
Pressure Rated at 345 PSI at 365 degrees F.
Equipped with Pressure relief Valve set at 200 PSI.

                                                          PASSIVE MITIGATION AND SAFETY DEVICES

The storage tank is located inside a concrete diked area capable of holding the entire 63, 000 lb contents plus 10%. The diked area also contains 6 inches of water to serve as a water blanket should a release occur. Cs2 weighs approximately 10.5 lbs per gallon and is only slightly water soluable. This water blanket will contol vapors reducing the chances of fire or explosion. There is a 15 lb nitrogen blanket on the Cs2 storage tank 24/7. The nitrogen system is equipped with a low pressure alarm. If nitrogen pressure drops below 5 PSI an audible alarm will sound alerting everyone of the potential problem. There are inventory controls in place to ensure that there are no more than 63, 000 lbs ( 6,000 Gallons ) in the tank at any time. The storage tank is also situated on load cells to assist with the inventory control. The tank truck unloading area is a concrete pad with secondary containment to contain any release. The tanker unloading area is equipped with bonding and grounding straps to eliminate static electricty. The pumping system is equipped with a remote Emergency Stop button. 

                                                                 TRAINING AND WRITTEN PROCEDURES

There are written p

rocedures for the unloading of the Cs2 into the storage tank. There are also written procedures for transfering the Cs2 from the storage tank to the reactor day tank area. Then written procedures for moving Cs2 from the day tank to the reactor for processing. Employees involve with the unloading, transfering or processing of the Cs2 recieves extensive class room training on the health and physical hazards associated with Cs2. The employee also recieves training on the written procedures and emergency response before working with the Cs2. The operator then receives on the job training with a senior operator for as long as it takes to prove he/she is competent to be a reactor operator. Refresher training is conducted at least every 3 years.

                                              SAFETY, MANAGENT  OF CHANGE AND MECHANICAL INTEGRITY

A  Process Hazard Analysis has been performed to ensure that the equipment is safe, written procedures are in place and everyone understands the process and hazards associated with it. Written procedures are in place to manage any change in the process.  Weekly, monthly and yearly inspectons are in place to ensure proper maintenance and to maintain sound mechanical integrity of all equipment.

                                                                              EMERGENCY RESPONSE

Written emergency procedures are in place for an accidental fire or release. All employees are trained in their responsibilities should such an incident occur. We have performed both worst case and alternative scenarios and discussed them in detail with the local fire department.
